page.title: 02SPINNING & WEAVING -REDGATES
page.content: { {REDGATES} is situated in the{Exe {Valley}and here all aspects of spinning,knitting and weaving are taught. The wool is taken from the fleece, carded and hand spun on the traditional spinning wheels, washed and knitted into jumpers, cardigans and shawls. After spinning, the wool can be woven into material for making skirts, jackets and blankets. If desired the wool can be dyed using natural products - lichen, onion skins etc. The craft is taught at the Further Education College, week-end schools are held, demonstrations at shows and as far away as Japan have been given and Redgates hold the world record for the completion of a sweater - shearing, spinning and knitting to the final product - 1 hour 55 minutes.
